verses.roman:
yadyapi nirmala rādhāra sat-prema-darpaṇa
tathāpi svacchatā tāra bāḍhe kṣaṇe kṣaṇa

synonyms: yadyapi—although; nirmala—pure; rādhāra—of Śrīmatī Rādhārāṇī; sat-prema—of real love; darpaṇa—the mirror; tathāpi—still; svacchatā—transparency; tāra—of that; bāḍhe—increases; kṣaṇe kṣaṇa—every moment.
translation: "Although Rādhā's love is pure like a mirror, its purity increases at every moment.
